But listen again O listeners sitting contented listen again Its grave news now I\u2019ll pump into your shelters. The end ofthe world Hasbeenpostponed.(Repeatandscream)HAS BEEN POSTPONED. Note: the music was specially composed byAnthony Burgess. 105 107 \n￼Senilio Re-reads Baudelaire More reminiscences than if I was ninety... Great ugly desk, each groaning drawer a year Stuffed with bits of paper, crammed With bills, bank statements, songsheets, tax demands, Keepsakes for what, and letters never sent, Scraps cut from the New Statesman, 1947: My private secrets are more numerous - The inside of my head\u2019s a catacomb, Sad slaughterhouse, an Inca pyramid, More corpses than Mortlake. I\u2019m a graveyard the moon hates as she shines on it, Worms drag themselves all through and over it, Eating and eating again my most dear dead. I\u2019m somebody\u2019s old drawing-room Full of furniture about to become antique - You could call it Betjemanesque - There\u2019s a smell of lavender or lilies -of-the-valley, is it? Anyway it smells. There\u2019s nothing longer than the shortest day Yearlong of frost and fog, traditional - One doesn\u2019t want to know. The messy street Extends a boredom to eternity - Write off living. Come to life At sunset only, down along the houses - It\u2019s sunset.
